required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extended Access Program to Assess Long-term Safety of Bardoxolone Methyl in Patients With Pulmonary Hypertension RANGER
clinical_study.official_title: An Extended Access Program to Assess Long-term Safety of Bardoxolone Methyl in Patients With Pulmonary Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This extended access study will assess the long-term safety and tolerability of bardoxolone methyl in qualified patients with pulmonary hypertension (PH) who previously participated in controlled clinical studies with bardoxolone methyl.

detailed_description.textblock:
This extended access study will assess the long-term safety and tolerability of bardoxolone methyl in qualified patients with pulmonary hypertension (PH) who previously participated in controlled clinical studies with bardoxolone methyl.
Qualified patients will receive 10 mg of bardoxolone methyl once daily until the drug is available through commercial channels or until patient withdrawal, whichever is sooner. Dose de-escalation (down to 5 mg) is permitted during the study, if indicated clinically.

primary_outcome.description: Long-term Safety as Measured by Incidence of Adverse Events During the maximum study duration of 5 years

arm_group.description: Bardoxolone methyl will be administered orally once daily at 10 mg until it becomes commercially available. Dose de-escalation (down to 5 mg) is permitted during the study, if indicated clinically.
